question.title: Will Mexico eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican government officially announces the complete elimination of export taxes on all agricultural products. question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Skagway, Alaska, vote to ban cruise ships on Fridays by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official RBI communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by RBI officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Rand Paul publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on healthcare funding?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Rand Paul publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Indonesia eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Italy and Australia have publicly announced the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023. question.title: Will Saudi Arabia become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Saudi Arabia is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include Saudi Arabia as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Saudi Arabia's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

The statement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). question.title: Will Canada maintain its ban on single-use plastics through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Canada has not officially reversed its existing ban on single-use plastics. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize their use. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow single-use plastics before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Slack lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Slack confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern in July 2022. question.title: Will Moscow announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 World Cup venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI research lab's chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Intel implement court-ordered changes to its processor licensing agreements by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Intel implements any changes to its processor licensing agreements as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Intel, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in licensing terms, pricing structures, or distribution agreements. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

This question will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat items because of a listeria contamination. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following channels:

1. An official announcement on the website or social media accounts of Maple Leaf Foods
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. A statement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to a recall by Maple Leaf Foods
4. Reports from a minimum of three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) quoting official sources

The recall must explicitly indicate listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these conditions is declared by the given date, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Utah legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oscar Mayer makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its hot dog items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be verified through at least one of the following means:

2. A press statement from Oscar Mayer
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to an Oscar Mayer recall

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Fisker receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that Fisker has received in excess of $500 million in funding from the U.S. federal government for projects related to electric vehicles. Such projects may encompass manufacturing, assembly, or other facets of electric vehicle production. Verification must arise from official government disclosures, statements from Fisker, or reports from no fewer than three prominent news outlets (for instance, Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The funding must be earmarked specifically for electric vehicle-related endeavors and not for general automotive uses. question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial fraud involving at least five major financial institutions. Completion must be confirmed through an official FCA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FCA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. question.title: Will Bank of India issue pass-through certificates worth at least $1 billion by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bank of India issues pass-through certificates with a total value of at least $1 billion (or its equivalent in Indian Rupees) as part of a loan sale. question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Marta Rovira return to Spain and face a trial related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Marta Rovira returns to Spain and is officially put on trial for her involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Rovira physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Rovira's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Rovira is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to increase the FDA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes an increase of more than 20% in the budget of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. question.title: Will Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receive European marketing approval by July 2024 for mild cognitive impairment?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receives marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for the treatment of mild cognitive impairment by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly rejects the approval, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will Twitter announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Twitter officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 20% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Twitter only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 20% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Supreme Court justices is officially adopted by the United States government. question.title: Will Ohio maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Ohio remains at $11 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Ohio state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Ohio state law.

question.title: Will Italy's FTSE MIB index reach or exceed 28,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Italy's FTSE MIB index reaches or exceeds 28,000 points. The 28,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Borsa Italiana. If the index does not reach 28,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 28,000 points.

question.title: Will Indonesia officially declare an end to its current dengue outbreak by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Indonesian government or its official health authorities make a formal declaration that the dengue outbreak in Indonesia has ended. The declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) or by the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration should specifically state that the dengue outbreak that began in 2023 has been contained or ended. If no such official declaration is made and reported by the specified date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case regarding abortion rights. question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Imelda Marcos remain in prison for her corruption sentence in July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, for the entire month of July 2024, Imelda Marcos is serving her corruption sentence in prison and has not been granted house arrest or any other form of release. The resolution will be based on official announcements from Philippine authorities or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, The Straits Times) confirming her continued imprisonment throughout July 2024. If she is released, allowed to serve her sentence under house arrest, or granted any form of temporary release during July 2024, even if it's just for a portion of the month, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'prison' refers to a standard correctional facility, not including house arrest or any form of modified confinement outside a traditional prison setting.

question.title: Will Los Angeles announce a public transit-only policy for 2028 Olympic venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Los Angeles or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2028 Summer Olympics will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to Olympic venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Wisconsin hold a referendum on mental health services funding by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Wisconsin conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on increasing funding for mental health services in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Wisconsin.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on mental health services funding.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Twitter announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Twitter publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. question.title: Will Xiaomi distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Xiaomi officially distributes its smartphones to North Korean athletes participating in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. For a YES resolution, all of the following conditions must be met:

1. Xiaomi must proceed with the distribution despite any potential concerns about U.N. Security Council sanctions.
2. The distribution must be confirmed by official statements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic authorities.
3. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

The question resolves as NO if any of the following occur:
1. Xiaomi officially announces that it will not distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes.
2. The distribution is officially halted or canceled before completion.
3. By August 31, 2024, there is no clear confirmation that the distribution to North Korean athletes has taken place.

Note: This question does not consider the legality or potential consequences of such a distribution, only whether it occurs.

question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse Joe Biden for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) officially endorses Joe Biden for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the UAW endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.
